alert.note: Alert for Pickaway (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 09 at 5:14AM EST until March 09 at 9:40PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers... Scioto River at Circleville. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Scioto River at Circleville. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 17 feet, lowland flooding continues along the river, with flooding along Island Road continuing. Canal Road near State Route 104 also continues to have flooding, as well as Cooks Creek Golf Course and State Route 762 in northern Pickaway County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM EST Wednesday, the stage was 16.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 AM EST Wednesday was 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 9.4 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to developments by listening to NOAA Weather Radio. For additional details on river forecasts, visit water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=iln
